intro: Oxypetalum pauperculum, commonly known as the poorflower or slender bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a hairy texture. Oxypetalum pauperculum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
